Debt * Alabama Power Co., Birmingham, a unit of Southern Co., Atlanta, is offering $200 million in 8.50 percent first-mortgage bonds due May 1, 2022, priced at 99.375 to yield 8.557 percent through Kidder, Peabody. Nonrefundable for five years, the bonds are rated A-1 by Moody's and A by S.& P. * Heritage Media Services Inc., a unit of Heritage Media Corp., Dallas, filed for up to $150 million of senior secured notes due 2002 through Goldman, Sachs.

* Merrill Lynch & Co., New York, is offering $150 million of 8 percent senior notes due June 1, 2007, priced at 98.125 to yield 8.22 percent through Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. The noncallable notes are rated A-1 by Moody's and A+ by S.& P. * Pennsylvania Power and Light Co., Allentown, is offering $300 million of first-mortgage notes in two parts. The first part is $150 million of 7 3/4 bonds due May 1, 2002, at 99.862 to yield 7.77 percent through First Boston. The second part is $150 million of 8 1/2 percent 30-year bonds at 99.784 to yield 8.52 percent, also through First Boston. The securities are rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.& P. * Philip Morris Cos., New York, is offering $300 million of 7 5/8 notes due May 15, 2002, priced at 98.798 to yield 7.80 percent through Lehman Brothers. The noncallable notes are rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.& P. * USX Corp., Pittsburgh, is offering $150 million of 9 3/8 percent notes due May 15, 2022, at 99.375 to yield 9.437 percent through Salomon Brothers. The notes are rated Baa-3 by Moody's and BBB- by S.& P. Common * Boston Scientific Corp., Watertown, Mass., made an initial public offering of 23.5 million shares of common stock at $17 a share through Goldman, Sachs. * Cardiovascular Imaging Systems Inc., Sunnyvale, Calif., made an initial public offering of 1.5 million common shares at $7 a share through Montgomery Securities. * Greater China Fund Inc. filed for a proposed initial public offering of 4 million common shares at $15 a share through Paine Webber. * Kohl's Corp., Menomonee Falls, Wis., made an initial public offering of 9.67 million common shares at $14 a share through Morgan Stanley.
